content.prompt: A chemistry teacher carried out several demonstrations, and students recorded their observations. For one of the demonstrations, a student concluded that a physical change took place, but not a chemical change. Which of the following observations could the student have made of the results of the demonstration?

choices.label: Two colorless solutions were combined, and the resulting solution was pink.
When a solid was added to a liquid, sparks were produced.
One piece of solid substance was changed into small pieces.
When two solutions were combined, a precipitate formed.

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
